TC.slowExecution.hint: Stop execution for 1 second after each step. Great for tracing errors!

TC.dontCloseBrowser.hint: When the browser or script finds an error, it usually takes a screenshot and moves on to the next testcase. With this setting to True the browser session will stop right at the error.

TC.Browser.hint: Choose browser for this test run

TC.BrowserAttributes.hint: Choose browser attributes for this test run and Browser

TC.BrowserZoomFactor.hint: Set the Zoom Factor level for the browser window. Default = 100. Switch e.g. to 70 or 120

TC.ParallelRuns.hint: How many sessions do you want to run in parallel

TC.Lines.hint: Lines to execute for this test case. Syntax: 1, 5, 9, 10-50, 700-900

TC.ExportAllFields.hint: Ignore other settings and export all fields of the testDataFile to export format

TC.Stage.hint: Set the Stage (usually DEV, QA, PQA, FQA, PROD, etc.). It is common to have master data or settings per stage. If that doesn't apply to you, use 'other'

TX.DEBUG.hint: Don't start new thread for execution. Use same thread. Used sometimes for debugging

TC.RestartBrowser.hint: After each TestCase restart the browser

TC.UseRotatingProxies.hint: Use rotating proxies for each new browser Session

TC.ReReadProxies.hint: Constantly search for available and working Proxy-Servers

CL.browserFactory.hint: Class for BrowserFactory, if you subclassed that by yourself

CL.browserHandling.hint: Class for BrowserHandling, if you subclassed that by yourself

CL.testCaseSequenceMaster.hint: Class for TestCase-Sequence, if you subclassed that by yourself

TC.TestStepClass.hint: Class for TestStep, if you subclassed this by yourself. This is uncommon to be set in Globals. Are you sure about it?

TC.TestDataFileName.hint: Name and Path of the datafile, that should be used instead of the datafile, that is specified in the TestRun Definition

TC.LogLevel.hint: Set the level of logging. Standard = 'debug'. For production you might want to change to another value
